definition: bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom

sentences.english: This is probably the result of long and boring office hours, when nothing interesting happens.
sentences.chinese: 这可能是漫长无聊刻板的办公时间导致的。

sentences.english: She tormented me with some silly questions.
sentences.chinese: 她问了些无聊问题烦扰我。

sentences.english: I dare say you're dull at home.
sentences.chinese: 我敢说你在家里感到沉闷无聊。

sentences.english: Here you can see the headstock just after I finished boring it.
sentences.chinese: 在这里您可以看到启闭刚刚结束后，我无聊了。

sentences.english: A little girl came to visit the country home, but was very bored.
sentences.chinese: 一个无聊的小女孩来到了农家院。

sentences.english: The very source of our boredom also provides a solid foundation of unadulterated comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我们无聊的源头也提供了稳定的舒适感。

sentences.english: And roamed there all the stupid afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 飘来飘去，一整个无聊的午后。

sentences.english: Very common with one of dull propagandist means, and above same.
sentences.chinese: 很普通和无聊的宣传方式之一，和上面一样。

sentences.english: Do not let her to spend these 15 seconds just dully waiting for you.
sentences.chinese: 所以，不要让她把这15秒花在无聊地等待中。

sentences.english: Stupid Cupid, stop pickin on me!
sentences.chinese: 无聊的丘比特，不要再找上我了。

sentences.english: It's called Cubix! It's stupid and pointless but good for killing time.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很无聊也没有什么意义，但值得打发时间。

sentences.english: Life would be boing for me (4)if I could not play football.
sentences.chinese: 知果我不能踢足球，生活对我而言将是无聊的。

sentences.english: She's always palming the worst jobs off on her assistant.
sentences.chinese: 她总是哄骗她的助手做最无聊的工作。

sentences.english: If you’re highly balanced and highly bored, what’s the point?
sentences.chinese: 如果你高度平衡但却极其无聊，那么又有何意义？

definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
to have nothing to do/to have time on one's hands
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
to stare blankly/to be stunned/to be lost in thought
bored/to be fed up with/sick and tired of sth
